node.name: SSH
node.rich_text:
Here I'm going to do the lab session:
Using auxiliary/scanner/ssh/ssh_version to find the version.
Setting the module to auxiliary/scanner/ssh/ssh_login and setting the required wordlists for user_file and password_file to bruteforce the password.
Then run exploit to enumerate the username and password.
Here you can see the the command shell sessions are opened. That means the ssh is done by entering username and password and we can directly enter to that session.

Or we can type “ ssh sysadmin@192.96.53.3” to enter into the ssh.
Now search for the flag, the flag is presnt in root directory.
Alternatively we can find all the users first by using the module auxiliary/scanner/ssh/ssh_enumusers first and then find the password using the previous module (auxiliary/scanner/ssh/ssh_login )
Here we found all the users using the module. Now we can find the password for each users seperately.
